abstractText: Three new acetylenic aromatic compounds, sterehirsutynes A−C (1−3), along with three known congeners, frustulosinol (4), vibrayne (5), and sterehirsutinol (6), were isolated from the culture broth of Stereum hirsutum. Their structures were determined by detailed analyses of NMR and high-resolution mass. Chiral column analysis showed that compounds 2 and 3 were racemic mixtures. These new compounds were evaluated for porcine pancreatic lipase (PPL) inhibitory activities, and compounds 1 and (±) 3 showed moderate inhibitory activity against PPL, with IC50 values of 23.2 ± 1.04 and 21.8 ± 2.15 μM, respectively.

sections.heading: SUPPLEMENTARY MATERIAL
sections.text:
Sterehirsutynes A−C: three new acetylenic aromatic metabolites from Stereum
hirsutum
Fei Liu, Qin Li, Mengsha Wei, Xin Kang, Hucheng Zhu, Weiguang Sun, Chunmei Chen*, Yonghui Zhang*
Hubei Key Laboratory of Natural Medicinal Chemistry and Resource Evaluation, Tongji Medical College, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, Wuhan 430030, Hubei Province, People’s Republic of China
*Corresponding author’s E-mail addresses: chenchunmei@hust.edu.cn (C.C.).
zhangyh@mails.tjmu.edu.cn. (Y.Z.).
Three new acetylenic aromatic compounds, sterehirsutynes A−C (1−3), along with three known congeners,
frustulosinol (4), vibrayne (5), and sterehirsutinol (6), were isolated from the culture broth of Stereum hirsutum.
Their structures were determined by detailed analyses of NMR and high-resolution mass. Chiral column analysis
showed that compounds 2 and 3 were racemic mixtures. These new compounds were evaluated for porcine
pancreatic lipase (PPL) inhibitory activities, and compounds 1 and (±) 3 showed moderate inhibitory activity
against PPL, with IC50 values of 23.2 ± 1.04 and 21.8 ± 2.15 μM, respectively.
Keywords: Stereum hirsutum, Aromatic alkyne, Porcine Pancreatic Lipase activities
